com.fasterxml.util.membuf
Class StreamyBytesMemBuffer

java.lang.Object
  com.fasterxml.util.membuf.base.MemBufferBase<S>
      com.fasterxml.util.membuf.base.StreamyMemBufferBase<BytesSegment>
          com.fasterxml.util.membuf.StreamyBytesMemBuffer
All Implemented Interfaces:
MemBuffer, StreamyMemBuffer, Closeable
Direct Known Subclasses:
StreamyBytesMemBufferImpl
public abstract class StreamyBytesMemBuffer
extends StreamyMemBufferBase<BytesSegment>

Byte-valued StreamyMemBuffer: memory buffer that stores sequence of bytes without preserving boundaries between different appends (that is, contents of a single append can be retrieved using multiple reads, as well as contents of multiple appends can be retrieved with a single read)

                  throws InterruptedException

Throws:

read

public abstract int read(byte[] buffer,
                         int offset,
                         int length)
                  throws InterruptedException
Method for reading and removing up to specified number of values from buffer and return length of data read. If no data is available, will block to wait for more data.

Parameters:
buffer - Buffer in which entry is to be read
offset - Offset in buffer to use for storing results
length - Maximum number of values to read
Returns:
Length of the read (in number of values); at least one is always read if buffer has enough room (special case being 0, in which case call may or may not block)
Throws:
InterruptedException

read

public final int read(byte[] buffer)
               throws InterruptedException
Throws:
InterruptedException

readIfAvailable

public abstract int readIfAvailable(byte[] buffer,
                                    int offset,
                                    int length)
Method for reading and removing up to specified number of values from buffer and return length of data read. If no data is available, will immediately return 0.

Parameters:
buffer - Buffer in which entry is to be read
offset - Offset in buffer to use for storing results
length - Maximum number of values to read
Returns:
Length of the read (in number of values) if data was available, or 0 if no data was available

readIfAvailable

public final int readIfAvailable(byte[] buffer)

read

public abstract int read(long timeoutMsecs,
                         byte[] buffer,
                         int offset,
                         int length)
                  throws InterruptedException
Method for reading and removing up to specified number of values from buffer and return length of data read. If buffer is empty, may wait up to specified amount of time for new data to arrive. If no entry is available after timeout, will return 0; otherwise returns number of values read

Parameters:
timeoutMsecs - Amount of time to wait for more data if buffer is empty, if non-zero positive number; if zero or negative number, will return immediately
buffer - Buffer in which entry is to be read
offset - Offset in buffer to use for storing results
length - Maximum number of values to read
Returns:
Length of the read (in number of values) if data was available, or 0 if no data was available
Throws:
InterruptedException
